snippet: Legislators approved the bill, opening the way for the authorities to create one of Latin America’s most ambitious nationwide endeavors in overhauling drug policy.
abstract: Uruguay’s lower house votes 50 to 46 to approve a sweeping bill to legalize marijuana, opening the way for one of Latin America’s most ambitious nationwide endeavors in overhauling drug policy.

byline.contributor: Mauricio Rabuffetti contributed reporting from Montevideo, Uruguay.

lead_paragraph: Legislators approved the bill, opening the way for the authorities to create one of Latin America’s most ambitious nationwide endeavors in overhauling drug policy.

headline.main: Lawmakers in Uruguay Vote to Legalize Marijuana
headline.print_headline: Lawmakers in Uruguay Vote to Legalize Marijuana
